name: Easy Brioche Bread Pudding
author: Lisa Boutin
summary: My mom always begs me to make her favorite dessert. This one I created was a winner. Moist and delicious, the addition of nuts and fruit make it extra special!
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Tear bread into 1-inch pieces and place in an 8-inch square baking dish
Drizzle with melted butter and sprinkle with pecans and raisins
Whisk milk, sugar, eggs, cinnamon, and vanilla extract together in a medium bowl until combined and pour over bread mixture in the baking dish
Press gently on the bread until saturated
Let sit for a few minutes
Bake, uncovered, in the preheated oven until top is puffed but set, about 40 minutes
Pudding will settle back down as it cools
